example.eg: Riding a bicycle without a helmet is a risk I prefer to avoid.
example.egtrans: 不戴头盔骑车很危险，我宁可避免。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 引起危险的事物，危害之源, 风险，危险

example.eg: What is the risk of breast cancer in women aged 50-60?
example.egtrans: 50至60岁之间的妇女患乳腺癌的风险有多高？

example.eg: You're risking your life by driving at that speed.
example.egtrans: 你车开得那么快，是在拿生命冒险。

example.eg: I risked all my money in the casino.
example.egtrans: 我把所有的钱都投入赌场。

example.eg: I risked bankruptcy with that last deal.
example.egtrans: 我冒着破产的风险完成了上一笔交易。

example.eg: This insurance policy covers us against the risk of fire and theft.
example.egtrans: 这份保单为我们保火险和失窃险。

example.eg: The attorney evaluated the risk with his client.
Driving while drunk puts people's lives at risk.
example.egtrans: 酒后驾驶的行为将人们的生命置于危险中。

example.eg: Urban women in the age group of 30-45 years have emerged as an at-risk population for heart diseases.
example.egtrans: 30-45岁的城市女性已经成为心脏病的高发人群。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 处于险境的, 高危的

dsense.name: at risk of, also US: at risk for [sth]

example.eg: People who smoke are at increased risk for cancer.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 处于...的危险境地, 有...的危险

example.eg: Swim in the river at your own risk.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 由自己负责, 自担风险

example.eg: I know it seems expensive but I know it will increase in value so I think it will be worth the risk.
We took a calculated risk and drove to Bob's house in the hope that he would be there.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 权衡利弊后认为值得承担的风险

example.eg: The churn risk is the customer's likelihood to defect and switch to another company.
Throwing a cigarette out of the car window is a fire risk.
Motorcycle racing is a high-risk sport.
I have a low risk pregnancy.

dsense.name: pose a threat, pose a risk
pose a risk to [sb/sth], pose a threat to [sb/sth]

example.eg: Neil's reckless behaviour poses a risk to everyone on the team.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 对…构成风险，对…构成危险

example.eg: You have put our lives at risk by driving so carelessly.

dsense.name: put [sb/sth] at risk of [sth], put [sb/sth] at risk of doing [sth]

example.eg: We were put at risk of severe sunburn, working outdoors at midday.
The company won't begin the project until a risk assessment is completed.
Risk-averse investors tend to avoid investments with high volatility.
The bank filed a report on its risk-bearing capacity.

dsense.name: risk capital
dsense.guideword: (econ: money invested in a new venture)

example.eg: Entrepreneurs are finding risk capital increasingly difficult to come by.
Risk management is the process of assessing risks and taking steps either to eliminate or reduce them.
I wasn't surprised when John sank all his money into that new business venture; he's always been a risk taker.
You risk your life when you drive too quickly.
The manager wants to improve the way in which the company risk-manages its business.
Sandra has never been keen on risk-taking.

dsense.name: run the risk, run a risk

example.eg: I could leave my kids home alone while I go to the store, but I don't want to run the risk.

dsense.name: run the risk of doing [sth], run a risk of doing [sth]

example.eg: You run the risk of becoming dehydrated if you don't drink enough liquids.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 冒...的风险, 承担...的风险

example.eg: Foreign nationals who are considered to be a security risk will be deported.
I can't imagine why you would take the risk.
Do you think it's wise to take the risk of starting a business in the current economic climate?
Scientists who chase tornadoes believe that the amount of information they gather makes it worth the risk.
